faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course covers the following topics:
- Discovering customer problems
- Defining a "value proposition" for a product/service
- Validating a value proposition
- Translating product vision into an initial prototype
- Attracting customers and creating demand
- Articulating a business model
description.et:
Aines kaetakse järgmiseid teemasid: 
- klientide probleemide avastamine
- toote või teenuse väärtuspakkumise defineerimine
- väärtuspakkumise valideerimine
- tootevisiooni põhjal algse prototüübi loomine
- klientide ligi meelitamine ning nõudluse tekitamine
- ärimudeli loomine ja täpsustamine

objectives.en: This course aims at providing students with the opportunity to apply the skills acquired throughout their curriculum in order to conceive and launch a software product or service using the principles of "lean start-ups".
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on pakkuda tudengitele võimalus rakendada õppekava jooksul omandatud oskuseid et mõelda välja ning algatada "kõhna idufirma" printsiipidest lähtuv toodet või teenust pakkuv ettevõte

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, a student will be able to:
learning_outcomes.et: Pärast kursuse edukat läbimist oskab üliõpilane:

learning_outcomes.en: 1.	Identify and analyze a problem to be solved by means of a software product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 1.	leida ning analüüsida probleemolukordi, mille lahendamiseks saab kasutada kas tarkvara või teenust;

learning_outcomes.en: 2.	Explain why current solutions do not address the identified problem(s) or why a new solution is needed
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	põhjendada, miks olemasolevad lahendused ei ole antud probleemile sobivad või miks on tarvis uut lahendust;

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	Articulate how the identified problem(s) will be solved by an envisioned software product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	seletada, kuidas planeeritud tarkvaratoode või -teenus tuvastatud probleemi lahendab;

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	Define who are the potential users of a new product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	kirjeldada oma toote või teenuse eeldatavat sihtrühma;

learning_outcomes.en: 5.	Formulate and validate a product vision and a business model
learning_outcomes.et: 5.	formuleerida ning valideerida tootevisiooni ning ärimudelit;

learning_outcomes.en: 6.	Translate a product vision into an initial prototype using an agile development method
learning_outcomes.et: 6.	luua visiooni põhjal agiilseid arendusmeetodeid kasutades algne prototüüp;

learning_outcomes.en: 7.	Apply the "Customer Development Framework" to incrementally refine an initial product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 7.	rakendada kliendist lähtuva arenduse raamistikku et inkrementaalselt toodet või teenust parandada;

learning_outcomes.en: 8.	Define a business model that takes into account requirements of suppliers and other partners.
learning_outcomes.et: 8.	defineerida ärimudel, mis arvestab pakkujate ja teiste partnerite vajadustega.

notes.et: This course is a practical course partly merged with the business development programme STARTER as it provides access to mentors, startup network and business ideas competition.  All relevant communication and updated information are in moodle. For more information turn to the course supervisor!

description.et: Interim report and individual reflection (instructions in moodle)

The final grade is established based on the performance in the assigned project, regular written reports, presentations(pitching), participation in the workshops and final  learning reflection report.
Participation in seminars at least 60% + mentor feedback and business ideas competition pre-selection is required. 
Formation of final marks: A 91 - 100%; B 81 - 90%; C 71 - 80%; D 61 - 70%., E 51 - 60%

grade_preconditions.et:
Students will meet for seminars and achieve the following milestones:
1. Define an initial "value proposition" of a software product or service
2. Develop a prototype of the envisioned product/service
3. Provide evidence that the initial prototype has been validated with prospective customers and that customer feedback has been documented and taken into account
4. Define a business plan for the product
Each milestone will be given a grade by the seminar coordinator based on the milestone's deliverables and an oral presentation. The points accumulated from the milestones will add up to a score between 0 and 100. This score will be translated into a grade between A and F using the standard university scale.
To pass the course, the student must score at least 51 points.

grade_evaluation.et:
Students will meet for workshops every week and achieve the following milestones:
1. Define an initial "value proposition" of a software product or service
2. Develop a prototype of the envisioned product/service
3. Provide evidence that the initial prototype has been validated with prospective customers and that customer feedback has been documented and taken into account
4. Define a validated business model for the product/service.
Reflections and milestones will be given points. The points accumulated from the milestones will add up to a score between 0 and 100. This score will be translated into a grade between A and F using the standard university scale.
To pass the course, the student must score at least 51 points.

debt_elimination.et: No resit exam is offered in this course.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
